name: St. Oberholz
description: A legendary coworking cafe at Rosenthaler Platz, known as Berlin’s original laptop-friendly hub. Two floors with ample space, sockets (especially upstairs), fast wifi, and a vibrant remote work community. The spot buzzes with freelancers, students, and remote teams. Expect decent coffee, snacks, and a relaxed policy for long work sessions.

name: Outsite Cowork Cafe
description: A detailed description of the cafe, its atmosphere, and why it's great for remote work. Include information about wifi, seating, noise level, etc.
address: Rua de S. Paulo 109, 1200-066, Lisboa, Portugal

name: Nuage Café
description: A tranquil coworking café in the Latin Quarter near the Pantheon. Designed specifically for remote workers, Nuage Café features dedicated workspaces, fast wifi, comfortable seating, a library area, and a peaceful atmosphere ideal for productivity or quiet meetings. Expect plenty of power outlets, artisan coffee, and a quiet, studious environment with light snacks available.
